title_sort: walt whitman to talcott williams, 16 june 1886
title: Walt Whitman to Talcott Williams, 16 June 1886
text: 328 Mickle streetCamdenJune 16 '86My dear friendEnclosed I send my piece in Thorndike Rice's just issued Lincoln Reminiscences—I don't know whether you will want it—but I do know you like to have earliest copies of any thing. Should you print it, I leave the head-lines & introductory to you—& dont forget to give Rice's book the due credit. Should you print, I wish you would send me here 25 copies paper.—I am ab't as usual—just going to drive down 12 miles to visit a poor young fellow, Walter Borton, very low with consumption.Love to Mrs. W. and the sister.Walt WhitmanIf you cant use it, return the enclosed proof to me. Walt Whitman to Talcott Williams, 16 June 1886
